raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Amoxicillin-clavulanate", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "Dog bites require antibiotic prophylaxis covering both aerobic and anaerobic bacteria, particularly Pasteurella multocida (most common), Staphylococcus, Streptococcus, and anaerobes like Bacteroides. Amoxicillin-clavulanate is the first-line treatment for dog bites as it provides broad-spectrum coverage including beta-lactamase producing organisms. Amoxicillin alone lacks coverage against beta-lactamase producers. Doxycycline can be used as an alternative in penicillin-allergic patients but is not first-line. Clindamycin alone would miss Pasteurella coverage. The presence of cellulitis 2 days post-bite indicates established infection requiring appropriate antibiotic therapy."}
